  • Exports
  Source   Edit

The engine module is responsible for playing a song from a module. Similar to a sound driver, the engine is stepped every frame and the APU's registers are updated in order to play music.common abbrievations fc - frequency control tc - track control mr - music runtime chno - channel number

Imports

apuio, common, data, private/apucontrol, private/enginecontrol, private/enginestate, private/hardware

Types

Engine = object
  musicRuntime: Option[MusicRuntime]
  time: int
  patternRepeat: bool
  frame: EngineFrame
  apuOp: ApuOperation
Music/Sfx engine. Plays a Song, creating an ApuOperation that can be applied to an ApuIo object. The Engine does not interface with an ApuIo object directly, in order to reduce coupling and code duplication.   Source   Edit

Procs

proc apply(apu: var ApuIo; op: ApuOperation; wt: WaveformTable) {....raises: [].}
Applys an ApuOperation to an ApuIo, by performing the register writes specified in op. wt is the waveform table to use for CH3 when setting waveforms.   Source   Edit 
func currentFrame(e: Engine): EngineFrame {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Gets the current frame, or the current state, of the Engine   Source   Edit 
func currentNote(e: Engine; chno: ChannelId): int {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Gets the current note, as a note index, being played for the given channel. 0 is returned if no music is playing.   Source   Edit 
func currentSong(e: Engine): Immutable[ref Song] {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Gets the current song that is playing, nil is returned if there is no song playing.   Source   Edit 
func currentState(e: Engine; chno: ChannelId): ChannelState {....raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Gets the current channel state of the given channel. An empty channel state is returned if no music is playing.   Source   Edit 
func getLocked(e: Engine): set[ChannelId] {....raises: [], tags: [].}
  Source   Edit 
func getTrackEnvelope(e: Engine; chno: ChannelId): uint8 {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Gets the track's current envelope setting, for the given channel. The envelope setting is either a volume envelope value or a waveform id. 0u8 is returned if no music is playing.   Source   Edit 
func getTrackPanning(e: Engine; chno: ChannelId): uint8 {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Gets the track's current panning setting, for the given channel. Panning ranges in value from 0-3. 0u8 is returned if no music is playing.   Source   Edit 
func getTrackTimbre(e: Engine; chno: ChannelId): uint8 {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Gets the track's current timbre setting, for the given channel. Timbre is a channel-specific setting that ranges in value from 0-3. 0u8 is returned if no music is playing.   Source   Edit 
proc halt(e: var Engine) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Halts the engine, or forces the current song to halt. Function does nothing if there is no music currently playing.   Source   Edit 
func init(_: typedesc[Engine]): Engine {....raises: [].}
  Source   Edit 
func isHalted(e: Engine): bool {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Determines if the current song being played has halted. If there is no song playing, true is returned.   Source   Edit 
func isLocked(e: Engine; chno: ChannelId): bool {....raises: [], tags: [].}
  Source   Edit 
proc jump(e: var Engine; pattern: Natural) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Jump to the given pattern in the currently playing song.   Source   Edit 
proc lock(e: var Engine; chno: ChannelId) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Locks the given channel for music playback. Function does nothing if there is no music currently playing.   Source   Edit 
proc play(e: var Engine; song: sink Immutable[ref Song];
          pattern, row: Natural = 0) {....raises: [], tags: [].}

Sets the engine to begin playback of the given song. song must not be nil. By default, the engine will play the song from the start, or pattern 0, row 0. You can override this position via the pattern and row parameters. An IndexDefect will be raised if these parameters are out of bounds for the given song.

Afterwards, the song can be played by calling step periodically.

  Source   Edit 
proc reset(e: var Engine) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Resets the engine to default state.   Source   Edit 
proc setup(apu: var ApuIo) {....raises: [].}
Performs the necessary APU writes to allow for music playback with the engine.   Source   Edit 
proc step(e: var Engine; itable: InstrumentTable) {....raises: [],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Steps for a single frame or "ticks" the engine.   Source   Edit 
proc stepAndApply(e: var Engine; itable: InstrumentTable; wtable: WaveformTable;
                  apu: var ApuIo) {....raises: [].}
Convenience proc that calls e.step and apu.apply in one go.   Source   Edit 
proc takeOperation(e: var Engine): ApuOperation {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Takes out the operation to be applied to an ApuIo. Should be called after step to apply register writes to an Apu.   Source   Edit 
proc unlock(e: var Engine; chno: ChannelId) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Unlocks the given channel, music will no longer play on this channel. Use lock to restore music playback. Function does nothing if there is no music currently playing.   Source   Edit
